Question: In Beowulf, after Beowulf kills Grendel, Grendel's mother descends on Heorot and seizes Beowulf's trusted advisor named...
Early in Invisible Man by Ralph Ellison, Mr. Norton describes the narrator as "his fate." When the narrator brings that up to Mr. Norton at the end of the book...
Option 1: Mr. Norton immediately recognizes the narrator and they become good friends
Option 2: Mr. Norton immediately recognizes the narrator, but they don't see each other again
Option 3: Mr. Norton does not remember the narrator, but remembers mentioning "his fate" to someone
Option 4: Mr. Norton recognizes the narrator, but does not recall mentioning "his fate" in any way
Option 5: Mr. Norton does not recognize the narrator, nor does he recall saying anything about "his fate."

Question: Which of the following are true according to How to Read Literature Like a Professor by Thomas Foster? Select two options.
Option 1: Literature does not usually grow out of other literature
Option 2: When a character drowns, it usually symbolizes baptism
Option 3: Self-knowledge is always the real reason for a quest
Option 4: Keys and bowls are common examples of sexual symbolism

Question: According to How to Read Literature Like a Professor, who is the one truly responsible for a character's death in a story?
In many of Langston Hughes's poems (one example being "As I Grew Older"), he uses the sun and shadow to represent...
In Grendel by John Gardner, after the death of the Shaper, who sang a song about Finn at his funeral (effectively replacing him)?
In Oedipus Rex by Sophocles, in what way has Oedipus's blindness changed from the beginning to the end of the play?
Option 1: Oedipus was literally blind in the beginning; his daughter Samara restored his vision prior to killing him
Option 2: Oedipus was literally blind in the beginning; his vision was restored, but he became figuratively blind by forgetting his history
Option 3: Oedipus was figuratively blind in the beginning, being unable to remember people's names; he later blinded himself physically
Option 4: Oedipus was figuratively blind in the beginning, unaware of the Ancient Greek audience; he then physically blinded himself, giving him the ability to see the audience through the fourth wall
Option 5: Oedipus was figuratively blind in the beginning, unaware of his origins and his past; he later physically blinds himself when he learns the truth

Question: Who dies during the events of Hamlet by William Shakespeare? Select all that apply.

Option 4: The universal flood that killed everyone except Noah, his family, and pairs of animals
